reference.title: CEX7C information
reference.shortdesc: Since the catcher daemon listens on one particular numbered port, it is impossible to allow a legacy catcher daemon to co-exist with a newer catcher daemon. This must be the new catcher to support the newest .

ul.li:
The newest catcher must support all in-service CPRB types:
T5 (CCA 4.*)
T6 (CCA 5.*, CCA 6.*, and CCA 7.*)
libcsulcca.so supports access to both types of CPRBs.

section.p: The catcher daemon listens on a single port for management communication. This port number has not changed for the CEX4C or later release. Therefore, the new daemon supports management communication to the CEX4C - CEX7S-CCA or later adapters. Special steps are taken in the install/uninstall and daemon management for the CEX4C or later release to ensure that the new daemon is running when it is available.

section.title: versions for CEX*Cs

ul.li: V7.2: CEX4Cs are reported by 7.2 as CEX3Cs. CEX4Cs are only supported by 7.2 or later if the Linux driver reports them as CEX4s.
A V8.0 or higher workstation is required to see CEX5Cs. CEX4Cs, and CEX3Cs.
A V9.0 or higher workstation is required to see CEX6Cs and to exploit .
A V9.2 workstation is required to manage CEX7C coprocessors.

section.p: For more information about the TKE workstation, see .
